title: Power rule

title: Expression
text: We will start by setting the function insisde the integral going from $$x=1$$ to $$x=3$$. We then obtain $$\int_{1}^{3} x^2-3x \,dx$$

title: Compute the integral
text: What is the answer for this integral?

title: Compute the integral
text: The antiderivative is $$\frac{x^3}{3}-\frac{3x^2}{2}$$ with the boundaries of $$x$$ going from $$1$$ to $$3$$.
speech: The antiderivative is  fraction, x cubed, over 3,  minus fraction, 3 x squared, over 2,   with the boundaries of  x  going from  1  to  3 .

title: Evaluate the integral
text: On the next step, we will simply subsitute $$x=1$$ and $$x=3$$ into the antiderivative and substract F(3) from F(1) where F(x) indicates the antiderivative of the given function f(x)
